definition: to seek luck and avoid calamity (idiom)
to hasten/to hurry/to walk fast/to approach/to tend towards/to converge
lucky/giga- (meaning billion or 10^9)
surname Ji/abbr. for Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3]
to avoid/to shun/to flee/to escape/to keep away from/to leave/to hide from
vicious/fierce/ominous/inauspicious/famine/variant of 兇|凶[xiong1]

sentences.english: Feng Shui is permeated with a for people to "stay out of trouble, " the main line.
sentences.chinese: 風水學貫穿着一條爲人們“趨吉避凶”的主線。

sentences.english: The 'Evil Eye', symbolising good luck and protection sparkles brilliantly.
sentences.chinese: 璀璨奪目的邪惡之眼，是幸運與趨吉避凶的象徵。

definition: to be successful in every endeavor
to make money
to take a tonic or nourishing food to build up one's health
(of a political career) everything is going smoothly (idiom)
small capital, huge profit (idiom); to put in a little and get a lot out
divination/divinatory art
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert disaster
to make life longer/to promise longevity/(this product will) extend your life
illustrious/influential/prestigious
disaster/calamity
magnanimous
retort with challenging questions/debate
solid learning/real ability and learning/genuine talent
to alter one's fate/to improve one's luck (e.g. by changing one's name or phone number)
lit. opening a book is profitable (idiom); the benefits of education
retribution
